intro: Centella ulugurensis, commonly known as the Uluguru pennywort, is a flowering plant native to the Uluguru Mountains in Tanzania. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of white flowers. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. It has been traditionally used in local medicine for its purported healing properties. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
